page.title: 06FARMING TODAY
page.content: More land is being ploughed owing to the marginal returns on grazing in a grassland area.The average farm size is approximately 100 hectares. The main crops are wheat, barley & oil seed rape, with occasional potatoes & oats. There is a slight swing to unusual crops like peas & linseed. Straights & liquid fertilizers are beginning to be used on the land. Sheep are kept for fat lamb production & there some good pedigree dairy herds Cattle for beef production are both reared & bought. Silage is made, & increasing amount of big round bales are produced for feed & bedding. One man is employed to approximately 100 hectares. Rugby is the central market, but Banbury is used on occasions & some stock is sold direct.
